New Records: Sam Curran took 9 wickets in the tournament, with an economy rate of 6.28; Mark Wood, the fastest bowler of the World Cup so far, had 6 wickets; Wanindu Hasaranga had 13 wickets in 7 matches, leading Sri Lanka's bowling
Key Match Events: England won the match by 4 wickets with 2 balls remaining; Sri Lanka's struggle to chase the target despite key players; the match was crucial for England's knockout stage progression
Pre-Game Insights: England needed a win to secure their place in the knockouts; Sri Lanka aimed to disrupt England's qualification; Sam Curran and Mark Wood were highlighted as key bowlers; Sri Lanka's spinners and England's pace were anticipated to be pivotal
Post-Match Reflections: England's victory secured their place in the knockout stage; Sri Lanka's campaign ended on a disappointing note
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the SCG; the pitch was in good condition but worn; Chamika Karunaratne's potential inclusion in Sri Lanka's XI was noted; historical context of the rivalry between the teams
